contentrichtext.text: '''Ragnar Arnalds''' (born July 8, 1938) is a former Icelandic [[Member of Parliament|MP]] and twice cabinet minister. He studied [[literature]] and [[philosophy]] in [[Sweden]] from 1959 to 1961 and graduated with a law degree from the [[University of Iceland]] in 1968. He was editor of ''[[Frjáls Þjóð]]'' in 1960. Arnalds served as a Minister of Education and Transportation from 1978 to 1979 and [[Minister of Finance]] from 1980 to 1983. He was chairman of the [[People's Alliance (Iceland)|People's Alliance]] (''Alþýðubandalagið'') from 1968 to 1977. He also served as chairman of [[Heimssýn]], the Icelandic organisation opposed to membership of the [[European Union]], from 2002 to 2009. At present Arnalds serves as a member of the board of governors of the Central Bank of Iceland. He is a member of the [[Left-Green Movement]] (''Vinstrihreyfingin - grænt framboð'').
